quicksort

static void quicksort(int[] a,
                      int p,
                      int r,
                      SortTimes st)
Implements the Quicksort algorithm in the CLRS book. Sorts array of integers into ascending order. Note: Java arrays count from 0, not 1.

Parameters:
a - Array being sorted. Only a section of it, elements p through r, will get sorted on each invocation.
p - Lowest index to be sorted
r - Highest index to be sorted.
st - SortTimes object that gets incremented with the operations executed

partition

static int partition(int[] a,
                     int p,
                     int r,
                     SortTimes st)
Rearranges the subarray a[p..r] in place

Parameters:
a - Array to partition
p - Lowest index to start partitioning
r - Highest index to stop partitioning
st - SortTimes object that gets incremented with the operations executed
Returns:
Index of pivot. when done, all elements of a from p through (this index - 10 will be <= the pivot value, and all elements (this index + 1) through r will be > the pivot value.
